summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons incident report documenting Jeffrey Epstein's attempted suicide by hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on July 23, 2019. The report details the discovery, response, and initial disciplinary proceedings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who attempted to hang himself in his SHU cell at MCC New York. He was found unresponsive but breathing.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cell mate who alerted staff to the suicide attempt by stating Epstein had tried to hang himself.

persons.name: Silva
persons.context: Staff officer who, along with the reporting officer, heard noise from the cell, grabbed door keys, and called for assistance.

persons.name: Anderson
persons.context: Operations Lieutenant who arrived with additional staff after the incident and oversaw Epstein's removal from the SHU.

connections.description: They were housed together in SHU Cell 124 at the time of the incident.
Staff officer who responded to the incident involving inmate Epstein.
Operations Lieutenant involved in the response and removal of Epstein from the SHU after the incident.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to hang himself in his SHU cell (Cell 124) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, using an orange homemade rope. He was found unresponsive but breathing by staff.

events.title: Incident Report and UDC Action
events.description: A Unit Discipline Committee (UDC) found Epstein committed the prohibited act of self-mutilation (Code 228). The charge was referred to the Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) for further action.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide by hanging in his prison cell on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM.
The incident occurred in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
Epstein was found with an orange homemade rope around his neck; he was breathing but unresponsive when discovered.
His cell mate, Tartaglione, alerted staff to the incident.
The prison disciplinary system charged Epstein with the prohibited act of self-mutilation (Code 228) following the attempt.
